requirements.description:
Mandatory Requirement

As part of the eligibility and suitability requirement, NDIA seeks specified personnel who are Australian citizens.

Applicable for ACT, VIC and QLD: Labour hire licences are required in the state that specified personnel are being contracted.


The request seeks to engage experienced sellers who have capability to provide an APS5 Actuary (Professional Stream). This is a team membership position that may be required to perform work that involves team leadership responsibilities requiring the setting of priorities and allocating work to other lower level team members within a team. 

It will undertake activities and tasks using available information where options are not always evident. It will be required to perform procedural, clerical, administrative and operational tasks that supports and contributes to NDIA’s objectives to “build a world-leading National Disability Insurance Scheme”. 

The APS5 Actuary (Professional Stream) will have a considerable level of contact with stakeholders and will be required to communicate with and provide advice on a range of matters to resolve moderately complex to complex enquiries.

Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

  • Extracting, cleansing and preparing of data from multiple sources, in particular the data warehouse, and advising on appropriate data checks for reasonableness.
  • Updating and development of regular performance monitoring.
  • Supporting the Scheme Actuary Division to fulfill statutory requirements of the NDIS Act 2013 including the provision of data and analysis for reporting to the Board, Minister and for the purpose of public data sharing.
  • Utilising statistical and mathematical modelling techniques to undertake analytical work on a range of tasks, including actuarial monitoring and analyses, data tabulations, scheme projects and cost benefit analyses.
  • Undertaking ad hoc modelling requests and report production.
  • Effectively communicating (verbally and in writing) the progress of work responsibilities and outcomes of work undertaken.

(NOTE: the key responsibilities of the role are based on current priorities and may change over time)

Duties:

  • Work collaboratively with the website project team to develop the Drupal 9 website, ensuring the new website meets user needs, provides an optimal user experience, and meets technical standards.

  • Migrate, redevelop or reconfigure content types from the existing Drupal 7 websites.
  • Develop scripts for content migration from Drupal 7 websites.

  • Knowledge transfer to MDBA Web Team.

requirements.description:
The Department of Parliamentary Services (DPS) is seeking the services of an experienced Business Analyst to support its Electronic Security Systems (ESS) Enhancements Program. The Business Analyst will work with Subject Matter Experts (SME’s) to document system configuration and operational security responses required to meet the APH Security Operating Environment. The Business Analyst will produce use cases, process maps and supporting documentation that will form the Electronic Security System Event Manual and companion standard operating procedures and training materials.

To deliver on this program of works, the Business Analyst will be required to work within the Security Branch to:

  • Lead a range of stakeholder engagements to clarify, analyse and define security operational responses to electronic security system events
  • Collaborate with technical analysts and the alarms and alerts workflow enhancement team to support the design and development of solutions for responses to electronic security system events
  • Undertake data analysis of electronic security system events to inform the prioritisation of project work packages
  • Develop recommendations for the appropriate response to electronic security system events through analysis, verification, and validation
  • Provide input into the development of testing material and support testing activities with security operational and technical stakeholders
  • Work with security operations training and security policy and governance teams to update standard operating procedures and training materials to implement and operationalise the resulting changes to policy, process and procedure.
  • Other related activities to support the successful delivery as required

data.value: This role is within the Security Capability business team and will be based full-time onsite at Australian Parliament House.

This role will have a strong collaborative focus on bringing the digital and regulatory processes together specifically in the context of service design. Collaborate with user researchers and stakeholders to form the bigger strategic picture. Collaborate to build on and evolve existing strategies and if identified, developing new strategies for improvements across the service design. requirements.description:
Introduction

The Defence Science and Technology Group delivers world class Science and Technology research activities to support the defence of Australia and its national interests. Increasingly, these research activities are being digitally transformed, and rely on a rapidly growing volume of unique digital environments tailored to support leading edge technology and capability innovation.

Digital Science, Scientific Computing (DSSC) are seeking an organisation that can assist with the delivery of our ICT project portfolio to develop unique digital environments to support research in laboratories and deployed field settings.

Scope

Work with us in DSSC as part of an integrated delivery capability to support the delivery of our project portfolio. The scope of your support includes Program/ Project Management, Business Analysis, Project Analysis/ support and technical/ security engineering. Support delivery of the following projects in accordance with agreed project plans, project schedules and DSSC project methodology:

  • Compute – Virtualisation
  • Service Management Uplift
  • Integrated Research Data Storage Uplift
  • Research Trials Networks
  • HPC Onboarding and Migration
  • Collaborative Compute

requirements.description:
Geoscience Australia (GA) is seeking an experienced software developer with Python and ideally AWS experience to review, update, integrate and provide ongoing support for GA’s seismic processing and data acquisition systems, as part of our community safety focused suite of applications and services.

You will work as part of a small DevOps team to develop and maintain robust, highly-available and secure operational and scientific systems. The team uses AWS cloud and on-premises compute to host our systems and is actively migrating on-premises components to AWS. The team supports the systems that underpin the National Earthquake Alerts Centre (NEAC), the Nuclear Explosion Monitoring service, monitoring of the Earth’s magnetic field, and the operation of the real time sensor networks that provide data to these services.

Through its work, the team contributes to the safety of all Australians and the peoples of our region.

We use Terraform, Docker BitBucket, Python and Linux Shell Scripting/Bash in our environment.

The services will include but not be limited to:

· ongoing development, testing and maintenance of software solutions

· development of additional capabilities for our community safety systems – including converting scientific research into operational systems

· ongoing modernisation of systems – including the migration of on-premises systems to cloud

· contribute to a positive culture of continuous improvement, agility, security, and user engagement
